Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading when detecting listBox control with scrollbar
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.23558.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It's a regression issue. Not repro on .NET 8.0/7.0/6.0.

### Issue description

Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading and does not display test results.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/e54014b2-8d7e-45b7-a50e-66abc009a750

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/bb9349e7-cfa2-4be5-b929-0bb0aa7e3c26)




### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core application with ListBox control.
2. Add multiple Items to the ListBox and make sure it has scrollbars.
3. Build and run the application.
4. Open the Accessibility Insights tool, Select the ListBox and click Test Element.

**More Info:**
1. This issue is also reproduced in the CheckListBox control.
2. This issue is not reproduced in the ComboBox and TreeView controls.
3. **This issue is only reproduced when the control has a scrollbar.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading when detecting listBox control with scrollbar" (#10258)

Issues.Title: ValuePattern.Value property changed event is not sent from TextBox control.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0 RC2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 7.0.13

### Issue description

When listening to UIA events from the TextBox control, only text changed event is sent in .NET 8. However, there is also value property changed event in .NET 7.

.NET 7
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/85718983/6fbb2ba7-083a-4185-8662-a411fe9d2fcd

.NET 8
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/85718983/fd75b565-f281-4a48-aa00-1fe1ac568c22

This may be caused by this PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7741 that implements the UIA provider for TextBox.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Insert a TextBox control to a Form.
2. Run the application.
3. Open Accessibility Insights for Windows and listen to UIA events of the TextBox.
4. Input characters in the TextBox and observe the events.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ValuePattern.Value property changed event is not sent from TextBox control." (#10257)

Issues.Title: Use ITypeInfo directly in StandardDispatch
Issues.Body:
CreateStdDispatch doesn't do anything other than pass through to ITypeInfo so we'll do the same directly and save some of the overhead and make the code clearer.

To avoid loading and unloading the ITypeLib repeatedly we'll simply keep it alive (via the ITypeInfo) once we've loaded it once. We can expect that in an app that uses these we'll continue to need them throughout the lifetime of the app.

This allows removing the IWrapperInitialize interface, which further simplifies the way things work. I'll follow up with a change that simplifies our ComWrappers a bit based on this.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10254)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use ITypeInfo directly in StandardDispatch" (#10254)

Issues.Title: Implement the ITypeDiscoveryService service
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9870


## Proposed changes

- Add ITypeDiscoveryService in default service container `ServiceContainer `of IDesignerHost
- Implement the ITypeDiscoveryService service

## Root cause of this issue:
- In the `PopulateColumnTypesCombo ` function, the code attempts to obtain an `ITypeDiscoveryService `instance through the GetService method of `IDesignerHost `in order to discover all subtypes of `DataGridViewColumn`.
However, because `ITypeDiscoveryService` is not added in the default service container `ServiceContainer` of `IDesignerHost`, `GetService `returns null.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/1d604b5425cbbaf54f2b5be181096d1cf6b0271d/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/DataGridViewAddColumnDialog.cs#L657-L673

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The DataGridViewColumn can be added normally in DemoConsole project

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
The column type is empty
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/30d3bd42-5617-4d50-aa0d-907e0429cccc)

### After
The DataGridView column can be added normally from the Add column page

![AfterChange](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/eb3b650e-7651-431c-92b6-fa9a80f88559)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually (Add test to Dome project)

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 9.0.0-alpha.1.23519.1


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10247)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Implement the ITypeDiscoveryService service" (#10247)

Issues.Title: Unable to add full public IntPtr parameter to a Control
Issues.Body:
### Environment

17.7.34031.279
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.7.4
and
17.5.33627.172
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.5.5

### .NET version

tested on .NET 7.0 and .NET 6.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

It is working on .NET Framework 4.7.2

### Issue description

After adding an User control, that implements a public parameter with getter and setter - you won't be able to add it to the form through Designer Editor. Instead - A dialog box appears with a message: ***The connection to the server has been lost***
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/32906524/3ee1d822-daef-48e8-aa6d-b2bc9bd76a56)

You're still able to add the control through manual modification of the Form Designer File, but then - you won't be able to edit the form through Designer Editor.

### Steps to reproduce
1. On a WinForms Application - add new, or edit existing UserControl to the project.
2. Add to the UserControl's body these 2 lines of code:
```cs
IntPtr hwnd;
public IntPtr Hwnd { get => hwnd; set => hwnd = value; }
```
Keep in mind, that the parameter have to be public, and have to get both - a getter and a setter.
An example of the body of the UserControl may look as follows:
```cs
public partial class UserControl1 : UserControl
{
	private IntPtr hwnd;
	public IntPtr Hwnd { get => hwnd; set => hwnd = value; }
	public UserControl1()
	{
		InitializeComponent();
	}
}
```
3. After recompiling the project in a way, that the control appears on the Toolbox - Drag&Drop the UserControl on the Form's body.
4. Try to save the Form `Ctrl + S`. Now you reproduced the issue.

#### Alternatives
The following line of code will also generate the error:
```cs
public IntPtr HWnd { get => IntPtr.Zero; set => _ = value; }
```
But these lines of code will work properly:
```cs
private IntPtr hWnd;
public IntPtr HWndGet { get => hWnd;}
public IntPtr HWndSet { set => hWnd = value; }
```

#### Test Project
You may download attached project and check 4 cases, where every presented case (and additional case with non-public parameter) is available.
[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13285025/WinFormsApp1.zip)

### Diagnostics

```text
[20:12:22.005989] fail: StreamJsonRpc.ConnectionLostException: The JSON-RPC connection with the remote party was lost before the request could complete.
                           w System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           w System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           w StreamJsonRpc.JsonRpc.<InvokeCoreAsync>d__162.MoveNext()
                        --- Koniec śladu stosu z poprzedniej lokalizacji, w której wystąpił wyjątek ---
                           w System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           w System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           w StreamJsonRpc.JsonRpc.<InvokeCoreAsync>d__151`1.MoveNext()
                        --- Koniec śladu stosu z poprzedniej lokalizacji, w której wystąpił wyjątek ---
                           w System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           w System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           w Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClient.<SendRequestAsync>d__49`1.MoveNext()

                        Aby uzyskać informacje na temat rozwiązywania problemów z projektantem, zapoznaj się z przewodnikiem w https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
[20:12:22.125137] fail: Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientException: Połączenie z serwerem zostało utracone.
                           w Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClient.<SendRequestAsync>d__49`1.MoveNext()
                        --- Koniec śladu stosu z poprzedniej lokalizacji, w której wystąpił wyjątek ---
                           w System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           w System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           w Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.JoinableTask.CompleteOnCurrentThread()
                           w Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.JoinableTask`1.CompleteOnCurrentThread()
                           w Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Proxies.ControlProxy.GetParent()
                           w Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Designers.ControlProxyDesigner.get_ParentComponent()
                           w Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Designers.ComponentProxyDesigner.System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner.get_Parent()
                           w System.Drawing.Design.DesignerToolboxInfo.RecurseDesignerTree(IDesigner designer, Hashtable table)
                           w System.Drawing.Design.DesignerToolboxInfo.GetDesignerAttributes(IDesigner designer)
                           w System.Drawing.Design.DesignerToolboxInfo.Update()
                           w System.Drawing.Design.DesignerToolboxInfo.OnSelectionChanged(Object sender, EventArgs e)
                           w System.EventHandler.Invoke(Object sender, EventArgs e)
                           w Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.DesignSurfaceService.DisconnectSession(Boolean forcibleDisconnection)
                           w Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.VSDesignSurface.OnServerProcessExitedUnexpectedly()
                           w Microsoft.VisualStudio.WinForms.ProjectWatchers.ProjectWatcherService.ProjectWatcher.<>c__DisplayClass103_0.<<Client_ServerProcessExited>b__0>d.MoveNext()

                        Aby uzyskać informacje na temat rozwiązywania problemów z projektantem, zapoznaj się z przewodnikiem w https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to add full public IntPtr parameter to a Control" (#10246)

Issues.Title: System.Windows.Automation.InvokePattern.Invoke blocks on a menu item.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0.403

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Don't know, it works in .NET Framework 4.6.2, but not in latest version of .NET Framework 4.8

### Issue description

Run the unit test in the following solution. Notice that the unit test hangs on line 80 of UnitTest1.cs which is the InvokePattern.Invoke call on the FIle/Open... menu item.  This makes it impossible to test any menu item using System.Automation?  


### Steps to reproduce

1. on Windows 11 22H2 build 22621.2361
2. Load this solution into VS 2022
3. Run Test/Debug all tests
4. wait for windows open file dialog to appear
5. Notice it never disappears
6. hit break in the debugger and you will see it is blocked on line 80 of UnitTest1.cs.

[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13289996/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Windows.Automation.InvokePattern.Invoke blocks on a menu item." (#10244)

Issues.Title: When the cursor is not over any control and not in a row/column, chan…
Issues.Body:
Porting fix from the Out-Of-Process designer

## Proposed changes
When the cursor is not over any control and not in a row/column, change insertIndex to the last one.

## Root cause of this bug
In the original code, when the cursor is not on any control and not in a row/column, only the IBar is erased without processing the InsertionIndex of the control, so the top control cannot move to the bottom.

## Before
The top control cannot be moved to the bottom, it always backs to the original position.
![BeforeChange](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/f280c608-3f4b-4a27-b2bb-af69dc087528)

## After
The top control can be moved to the bottom
![AfterChange](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/32e8d9d0-bf61-4124-96ce-ce25ca94707d)





## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- .Net 9.0.0-alpha.1.23519.1


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10230)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "When the cursor is not over any control and not in a row/column, chan…" (#10230)

Issues.Title: Allows DataGridView to start row/column on index 1 on Narrator
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7154 

## Proposed changes

- Creates a new switch that allows developers to configure their application to make the starting index of rows/cells in DataGridView to be read by Narrator from 1, instead of 0;
- Adds checks on rows and cells of DataGridView to see if the switch is true. If true, starting index of rows/cells will be 1, instead of 0.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Developers will be able to configure their WinForms DataGridView rows/cells to be read by Narrator from index 1, instead of 0.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/5bcc7595-2278-4a4c-bddc-fc4561a4c554)

### After

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/ba65c3be-c486-460c-badd-2b7444109f0e)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30190295/aadda98f-f2d9-42bb-9f2a-6ecab6cf8a00)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual (Narrator)

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->
  
 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 9.0.100-alpha.1.23511.2


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10243)

Issues.Title: Font is not applied correctly if set on an invisible Control, and OnFontChanged is not called in PMv2 HDPI
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

In Per-Monitor v2 scenario if you set Font to an Invisible control and then set Visible to true, the Font size is scaled when the Handle of the control is created and no FontChanged event is generated in this case.
My scenario is 175% primary screen, 100% secondary screen.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/3384955/fa5e07b6-bd9a-45c7-bbf7-9f3ede92fd82)


### Steps to reproduce

Set up a primary screen to 175%, secondary to 100%
Run the attached DpiTest project on the secondary screen.
There are 2 labels, one of them is invisible, both are assigned the same font (size 12).
Clicking the Show button makes the second label visible.
I would expect the both buttons having the same font, or if this is a desired behavior (not sure why it actually should be), at least calling FontChanged, because the Font size is different than 12 which was assigned

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/3384955/a5eb397b-2c67-4970-bc63-0d2821a74ac3)

[DpiTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13277348/DpiTest.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Font is not applied correctly if set on an invisible Control, and OnFontChanged is not called in PMv2 HDPI" (#10237)

Issues.Title: Introduce a throw helper in DataGridView.Methods
Issues.Body:
While working on #9726, I encountered this factorisation opportunity. This cleans up the code and optimises it by getting the throw expressions out of the way.

As a follow-up, if the team is willing to modify the error messages, we could use `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` throw helpers inside the new method, but this change is less valuable

## Proposed changes

- Factorise EventArgs index bound checks in `DataGridView` in a dedicated helper method
